AIR PORE FILE.
CITY OF SAI MATRO, CALIFORNIA,
office of city Clerk
September 8, 1926.
MAYOR JAMES ROIPH, Ros and
BOARD OF
SUPERVISORS,
San Franci soo, California.
Dear Sirs:
Pursuant to resolution of the City Couneil of San Mateo,
the undersigned as ayor of the Miy, urges your serious considera-
tion of the proposed aviation field innediately adjoining San lateo
on the south for the use of San Francisco as a Innicipal Aviation
Field.
our consideration of the matter convinces us that the proposed
site has many advantages which makes it far superior to any of the
other proposed sites on the peninsula.
With an area of five Ianired aeres available, with a length of
over a mile and a half and a breadth of practically a nile, and with
an absolutely level surface, the landing and take-off possibilities
are anexcelled.
The proposed site is located between the Ieslie and Berestord
stations on the min line of the Southern Pacific Railway, with a
train service in excess of fifty trains per day, and
on the linin
State Highwy leading from San Frangisco to San Jose.
The climatic and air conditions are extraoriinarily good and
a portion of the proposed site has been used as an aviation field
for a number of years.
Aviators inform us that absence of fog and
wind make it possible
to land on this site at any and all times,
which would unquestionably offset the time consaned by the addi-
tional distance Iron San Francisco.
This field is imnediately available and without grading or
other inprovement could be used imnediately for aviation purposes.
It is also my understanting that the title to the property is in
such a condition that the site can be innedistely secured at a very
reasonable price.
Che proposed site is within a very short distance of the city
of San Mateo, which has under contemplation the annexation of the
property innediately aujoining the proposed site, and so far as the
aro, 210

City oi san Mateo can go in extending the custonary couriesies between
cities, it will do so in this instance for San Francisco In the way
of police protection, eto. that may be required.
We urge your serious and immediate consideration of this
proposed site.
Respectfully yours,
FREDERICK J. SHITH
Mayor of the City of San lateo.

properties.sfomuseum:description: Facsimile of correspondence from Frederick J. Smith, Mayor of City of San Mateo, to San Francisco Mayor James Rolph, Jr. and Board of Supervisors, dated September 8, 1926, outlining recommendation for proposed airport site between Leslie and Beresford Stations on main line of Southern Pacific Railway; two pages; file copy, not signed.
